content: Learn about the healing properties of nutmeg. Though you may think of it as a delicious spice, nutmeg has had many non-food uses throughout history, including use as treatment for diarrhea, nausea, and stomach upset. Nutmeg is anti-inflammatory and has a mild antibacterial property, and can be used in topical applications to help fight Propionibacterium acnes, the bacteria on your skin that causes inflamed acne. [2] [3] Nutmeg’s anti-inflammatory properties likely come from its myristicin, eugenol, and isoeugenol. [4] You should note that nutmeg is still considered less effective than standard treatments for acne, such as clindamycin. [5] Any nutmeg powder will work fine for this treatment, but it should be fresh to ensure that its properties are most effective. You can also use nutmeg essential oil. Choose a non-comedogenic oil. "Non-comedogenic" just means that the product won't clog pores and promote acne. According to the American Academy of Dermatology, the most non-comedogenic oils are mineral oil, shea butter, and sunflower oil. Castor oil is slightly comedogenic, but still ultimately harmless to the skin. Highly comedogenic oils that you should avoid putting on acne-prone skin include coconut oil, sesame oil, cocoa butter, and avocado oil. [6] Coconut oil does contain lauric acid, which is effective at combating the skin bacteria P.acnes that is responsible for inflamed acne (pus, pimples, etc.). However, coconut oil does not dissolve well in water, so it is difficult to completely cleanse your skin of it after you apply it. [7] Make a nutmeg paste. Mix two teaspoons of nutmeg powder with the non-comedogenic oil you chose. Only use enough oil to make a thick paste — it should not be watery. Add a few drops of lemon juice to the mixture. The lemon juice is used to lighten any darker areas of the skin. This combination of nutmeg, oil, and lemon juice is used to treat pimples and reduce scars and marks on the skin. [8] If you don’t have a non-comedogenic oil in your pantry, you can replace it with honey. The honey is antibacterial and can help heal blemishes. [9] [10] Try alternate pastes. Instead of nutmeg, you might use two teaspoons of ground cinnamon, ground fenugreek leaves or ground orange peels with your chosen oil/honey and lemon. Two teaspoons of turmeric mixed with neem oil is another wonderful option, as neem oil has astringent, antiseptic, and antibacterial properties and turmeric is an antibacterial, anti-inflammatory and anti-oxidant herb. [11] [12] Garlic has many antibacterial, antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. [13] A traditional Ayurvedic skin treatment calls for you to crush 2-3 cloves of garlic into a paste and apply it directly to your face. [14] Mix in some plain yogurt before applying it if you have sensitive skin. All of these alternatives to the nutmeg paste should follow the same application steps listed below. Prepare your skin. Before applying the paste, you want to make sure you’re working with a clean canvas. Using a gentle cleanser, wash your face to clear away excess surface oil and debris. Do not use products that contain alcohol, as they dry your skin and can make acne worse. Use a gentle cleanser such as Cetaphil or Aveeno. Do not use exfoliating brushes or other implements. Gently massage the cleanser into your skin using your fingertips. Rinse well with warm (not hot) water and pat your face dry with a clean towel. Apply the paste. You don’t need to smear the paste all over your face, as you might with a mud mask or home-facial peel. Instead, use a Q-tip to dot the paste onto problem areas on your skin, where you have either blemishes or scars/discolorations that need treatment. Leave the paste in place for at least 2 hours. Consider applying the paste before you go to bed, and letting it treat your skin while you sleep overnight. If you make the paste in larger quantities, you can use it as a facial wash or scrub, applying it to your entire face. Wash your skin clear. Once you’ve allowed the nutmeg paste to do its work, you can wash it away. Simply rinse it off with lukewarm water, and pat your skin dry. Make sure not to rub your face with the towel, as that could irritate your skin. Try Sunder Vati. Several clinical trials have demonstrated that Sunder Vati is one of the most effective of the Ayurvedic acne treatments. It is taken orally. [15] It may also be prepared as an ointment or gel. [16] You can usually find this preparation from a homeopath, but you can also ask your doctor to find out how to find an effective preparation. Sunder Vati includes the following ingredients: [17] Ginger Kutaj (Holarrhena antidysenterica) Biranga (Embelia ribes) Indian gooseberry Aloe Turmeric Guggulu Try an Ayurvedic combination treatment. Studies have suggested that trying a poly-herbal topical ointment, Shalmalyadilepa, and an oral treatment, Guduchyadivati, may be effective in reducing acne. Consult with an Ayurvedic medical practitioner. [18] Shalmalyadilepa contains Shalmali thorn ( Salmalia malabarica ), Vata buds ( Ficus bengalensis ), Jaatiphala fruits ( Myristica fragrans ), Lodhra bark ( Symplocos racemosa ), Massora seed ( Lens culinaris), and Raktachandana ( Pterocarpus santalinus ). Guduchyadivati contains equal parts Guduchi ( Tinospora cordifolia ) [19] , Manjistha ( Rubia cordifolia ), and Krishnasariva ( Hemidesmus indicus ). [20] Apply tea tree oil. Tea Tree, Melaleuca alternifolia, is a native Australian tree that has been widely used in Aboriginal medicine. Studies also show that it is highly effective at combating acne when applied in a 5% solution once a day for three months. [21] Tea Tree oil takes a little longer to work than other acne treatments, such as benzoyl peroxide, but it also has fewer unpleasant side effects (e.g., itching, dryness, or irritation). If you want the treatment to work a little faster, apply the oil to your skin twice a day, for 20 minutes per treatment. Wash your skin afterward with a gentle cleanser. Do this treatment regimen for 45 days. [22] Do not consume tea tree oil. It is toxic when ingested. [23] Make washing a regular part of your routine. Wash your face at least twice a day — once when you wake up to clear away oils that accumulate on the skin during sleep, and once before sleep to wash away the day's accumulation. [24] You should also wash your face after periods of heavy sweating, whether you've gone to the gym or just been outside on a warm day. Take a bath at least once a day, and consider taking an extra shower after heavy sweating. [25] Use a gentle, plant-oil based cleansing product. Look for a cleanser labeled as “non-comedogenic.” [26] This means that the product doesn’t promote the formation of comedones (blackheads or whiteheads) or pimples. Many brands — such Neutrogena, Cetaphil, and Olay — produce non-comedogenic products. There are also many off-brand or store-brand non-comedogenic products. You can also look for non-comedogenic oils to dissolve skin oils and clean the skin. Always read the packaging to be certain. Popular non-comedogenic oils include hemp seed oil, shea butter, sunflower oil, and castor oil. Avoid products that have alcohol in them, as it dries out and damages the skin. The dried, dead skin cells clog the pores, actually making acne worse. [27] [28] Use your fingertips to wash your face. If you use a washcloth or sponge to work cleansers into your skin, reconsider that practice. These products are rough against your skin, can irritate it, causing more problems than they solve. Instead, use your fingertips to massage cleansers into your skin. [29] Massage the skin gently. [30] You may be tempted to scrub at your skin during your daily washing, but this is a bad idea. The cause of your acne lies under the skin, and you cannot treat it through scrubbing, which only irritates the skin and worsens surface inflammation. Using your fingertips, gently massage the cleanser into your skin for 10 seconds or less, taking care not to irritate existing acne. Avoid exfoliation. [31] Exfoliation can be good for healthy skin, but you shouldn't try to exfoliate acne-covered skin. It can cause both micro-scarring that can't be seen without magnification, and more obvious scarring. [32] It can also pull away skin that's not yet ready to fall off, like pulling off a scab before it's ready. This can lead to scarring and discoloration. Chemical exfoliants detach the dead and dying skin cells, but can be drying and irritating as well. These over-the-counter treatments are different than the dermabrasion performed by dermatologists. A dermatologist uses techniques like laser resurfacing and microdermabrasion under magnification. They direct the treatment towards specific, very small areas, not the entire face. Professional treatments may not cause discoloration. Do not ever pop your pimples. [33] Pimples, pustules, blackheads, and so on may look unattractive, but they’re actually working to keep the bacteria in your skin contained. When you pop a zit, the white pus that comes out and touches your skin spreads the very bacteria that causes acne. If you absolutely must get rid of a pimple, see a dermatologist to lance it in a sterile, professional environment. At home, though, it’s best to simply let your zit run its course. Popping it might cause acne to flare up, lengthen the healing time, and increase scarring and discoloration. In serious cases, picking or popping a pimple can cause a severe staph infection. Learn the importance of underlying causes. You can treat skin blemishes all you want, but if you don't treat the thing that's causing it, acne will keep coming back. Now, this can't always be done. For example, if you're a teenager, your acne is likely a result of the fluctuating hormone levels that come with puberty, which can't be stopped until you outgrow it. You can also inherit a predisposition for acne from your parents, which can't be helped. [34] However, there are many things that cause acne that can be helped, and you should take measures to avoid those behaviors. Control androgen levels, if possible. Androgens are a family of hormones that includes testosterone, which is produced by both men and women (though in higher levels in men). [35] Testosterone increases the body's production of sebum, an oil that moistens the skin and keep it healthy. But when you have too much testosterone, the body makes more sebum than it can expel, making sebum accumulate and clog the skin. This can lead to inflammation and acne. [36] Teenaged acne in both boys and girls is often due to increased androgens. Unfortunately, it's often worse in boys, who have higher levels, and the underlying cause is untreatable until they outgrow puberty. Teenaged girls, though, can take prescription birth control to regulate their hormones, and therefore their sebum production. [37] Steroid use also affects androgens and sebum production. Stopping steroid use will likely improve the skin. Raise your fatty acid levels. [38] [39] Omega-3 fatty acids protect your skin by limiting the body’s production of leukotriene B4. Leukotriene B4 is known to increase sebum production and lead to inflammatory acne. By bringing your Omega-3 fatty acid levels up, you can prevent uncontrolled production of leukotriene B4 and help prevent acne. Foods you should look for include Walnuts Avocados Flaxseeds and flaxseed oil Fatty fish (halibut, herring, mackerel, oysters, salmon, sardines, trout, tuna) [40] Leafy green vegetables Foods and drinks fortified with omega-3 fatty acids (check the packaging) Treat inflammations that can become acne. Conventional thought on acne has been that its primary cause is bacterial, and it progresses to inflammation. However, recent research suggests that inflammation may actually lie at the heart of acne at all stages, not just late stages. [41] The presence of bacteria, this research argues, only serves to make skin conditions worse. Talk to your dermatologist about getting a prescription for anti-inflammatory medication to treat the underlying problem, rather than just treating the acne itself. Avoid foods that cause outbreaks. Everyone’s body reacts differently to food. Your friends might be able to eat foods that make you break out, and not get a single pimple. Take note of which foods seem to trigger acne in your body, and take lengths to either reduce or eliminate those foods from your diet. Foods with a high “GI” (glycemic index) ranking may make acne worse. [42] High-GI foods to watch out for include: Processed foods such as white bread, bakery products, potato chips, and french fries. These are usually “simple” carbohydrates that don’t offer much nutrition. Choose low-GI foods such as whole oatmeal, whole-grain bread, vegetables, and beans. If you crave potatoes, sweet potatoes and yams are lower-GI than white potatoes. [43] Sugar. Your body’s ability to regulate blood sugar may be linked to acne. High-GI foods and beverages often contain significant amounts of sugar. Dairy products. Dairy is not as strongly linked to acne as high-GI foods, but some studies suggest a connection. The American Academy of Dermatology does not recommend eliminating dairy products from your diet unless advised by your doctor, as they also contain essential nutrients such as calcium and vitamin D. [44] Choose lower-GI dairy products such as reduced fat yogurt over high-GI products such as ice cream. [45] Quit smoking. Research suggests a link between cigarette smoking and adult-onset, non-inflammatory acne, called “smoker’s acne.” [46] Though more studies need to be conducted on this link, a recent study of women found a direct correlation between the number of cigarettes smoked and the severity of acne. Reducing or eliminating cigarette smoking from your routine may be able to improve your acne. Choose cosmetics and beauty treatments carefully. Some cosmetics cause cells to build up in the hair follicles, causing black- or whiteheads that can become inflamed. This condition, called “acne cosmetica” or “cosmetic acne,” can be easily avoided by putting a little thought into what beauty products you put on your skin. [47] Look for non-comedogenic makeups that won’t clog your skin up, and avoid beauty products that have heavy perfumes in them. Avoid lotions and makeups that include penetrating oils like lanolin or isopropyl myristate, which can also trigger acne. Protect your skin from the sun. A popular myth suggests that a tan can help treat and prevent acne, but scientists have found no evidence to support that. [48] In fact, both the sun and tanning beds damage your skin and raise your risk for cancer. Always wear sunscreen and stay out of the sun during peak hours (10AM to 4PM). [49] Be aware that some acne medications or other types of medication can actually make your skin even more sensitive to the sun. These drugs include antibiotics such as ciprofloxacin, tetracycline, sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim; antihistamines like diphenhydramine (Benadryl); drugs used to treat cancer (5-FU, vinblastine, dacarbazine); heart drugs like amiodarone, nifedipine, quinidine and diltiazem; Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs like naproxen and the acne medications isotretinoin (Accutane) and acitretin (Soriatane).

<div class="ss_check" id="expert_coauthor">
	
	Co-authored by <a class="expert_icon expert_coauthor_link" href="#article_info_section">
		Lisa Bryant, ND</a>
</div>

		This article was co-authored by <a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=lisabryant%2Cnd#lisabryant%2Cnd">Lisa Bryant, ND</a>. Dr. Bryant is licensed Naturopathic Physician and natural medicine expert in Portland, Oregon. She completed her Residency in Naturopathic Family Medicine at the National College of Natural Medicine in 2014.<br/><br/>There are <a href="#references">50 references</a> cited in this article, which can be found at the bottom of the page.
		
	</div>
</div>
<p>The blemishes on your skin might be blackheads, whiteheads, pimples, pustules, cysts, or nodules. Whatever the type, they can be a nuisance. <sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup> However, some imperfections can be treated at home, and natural Indian face treatments are a great place to start.</p>

<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Using_Nutmeg_Paste_and_Other_Variations_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Using_Nutmeg_Paste_and_Other_Variations">Using Nutmeg Paste and Other Variations</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-1-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-1-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6d/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-1-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_c8c4597541" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_c8c4597541')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6d/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-1-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Learn about the healing properties of nutmeg.</b> Though you may think of it as a delicious spice, nutmeg has had many non-food uses throughout history, including use as treatment for diarrhea, nausea, and stomach upset. Nutmeg is anti-inflammatory and has a mild antibacterial property, and can be used in topical applications to help fight <i>Propionibacterium acnes,</i> the bacteria on your skin that causes inflamed acne.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Nutmeg’s anti-inflammatory properties likely come from its myristicin, eugenol, and isoeugenol.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>You should note that nutmeg is still considered less effective than standard treatments for acne, such as clindamycin.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Any nutmeg powder will work fine for this treatment, but it should be fresh to ensure that its properties are most effective. You can also use nutmeg essential oil.</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-2-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-2-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6c/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-2-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_454f2e9e75" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_454f2e9e75')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6c/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-2-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Choose a non-comedogenic oil.</b> "Non-comedogenic" just means that the product won't clog pores and promote acne. According to the American Academy of Dermatology, the most non-comedogenic oils are mineral oil, shea butter, and sunflower oil. Castor oil is slightly comedogenic, but still ultimately harmless to the skin.

<ul>
<li>Highly comedogenic oils that you should avoid putting on acne-prone skin include coconut oil, sesame oil, cocoa butter, and avocado oil.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Coconut oil does contain lauric acid, which is effective at combating the skin bacteria <i>P.acnes</i> that is responsible for inflamed acne (pus, pimples, etc.). However, coconut oil does not dissolve well in water, so it is difficult to completely cleanse your skin of it after you apply it.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-3-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-3-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/05/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-3-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_5d9a1132e6" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_5d9a1132e6')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/05/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-3-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Make a nutmeg paste.</b> Mix two teaspoons of nutmeg powder with the non-comedogenic oil you chose. Only use enough oil to make a thick paste — it should not be watery. Add a few drops of lemon juice to the mixture. The lemon juice is used to lighten any darker areas of the skin. This combination of nutmeg, oil, and lemon juice is used to treat pimples and reduce scars and marks on the skin.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you don’t have a non-comedogenic oil in your pantry, you can replace it with honey. The honey is antibacterial and can help heal blemishes.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-4-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-4-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-4-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_92d1ac90c8" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_92d1ac90c8')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-4-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try alternate pastes.</b> Instead of nutmeg, you might use two teaspoons of ground cinnamon, ground fenugreek leaves or ground orange peels with your chosen oil/honey and lemon. Two teaspoons of turmeric mixed with neem oil is another wonderful option, as neem oil has astringent, antiseptic, and antibacterial properties and turmeric is an antibacterial, anti-inflammatory and anti-oxidant herb.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 12" class="reference" id="_ref-12"><a href="#_note-12">[12]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Garlic has many antibacterial, antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 13" class="reference" id="_ref-13"><a href="#_note-13">[13]</a></sup> A traditional Ayurvedic skin treatment calls for you to crush 2-3 cloves of garlic into a paste and apply it directly to your face.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 14" class="reference" id="_ref-14"><a href="#_note-14">[14]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Mix in some plain yogurt before applying it if you have sensitive skin.</li>
<li>All of these alternatives to the nutmeg paste should follow the same application steps listed below.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-5-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-5-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b5/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-5-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_090db4484a" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_090db4484a')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b5/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-5-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Prepare your skin.</b> Before applying the paste, you want to make sure you’re working with a clean canvas. Using a gentle cleanser, wash your face to clear away excess surface oil and debris.

<ul>
<li>Do not use products that contain alcohol, as they dry your skin and can make acne worse. Use a gentle cleanser such as Cetaphil or Aveeno.</li>
<li>Do not use exfoliating brushes or other implements. Gently massage the cleanser into your skin using your fingertips. Rinse well with warm (not hot) water and pat your face dry with a clean towel.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-6-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-6-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-6-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_1ddab7786d" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_1ddab7786d')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-6-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Apply the paste.</b> You don’t need to smear the paste all over your face, as you might with a mud mask or home-facial peel. Instead, use a Q-tip to dot the paste onto problem areas on your skin, where you have either blemishes or scars/discolorations that need treatment. Leave the paste in place for at least 2 hours.

<ul>
<li>Consider applying the paste before you go to bed, and letting it treat your skin while you sleep overnight.</li>
<li>If you make the paste in larger quantities, you can use it as a facial wash or scrub, applying it to your entire face.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-7-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-7-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-7-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_625e0a7258" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_625e0a7258')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-7-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Wash your skin clear.</b> Once you’ve allowed the nutmeg paste to do its work, you can wash it away. Simply rinse it off with lukewarm water, and pat your skin dry. Make sure not to rub your face with the towel, as that could irritate your skin.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">

</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Using_Other_Natural_Treatments_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Using_Other_Natural_Treatments">Using Other Natural Treatments</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-8-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-8-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/eb/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-8-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_5f60e81d6b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_5f60e81d6b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/eb/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-8-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try Sunder Vati.</b> Several clinical trials have demonstrated that Sunder Vati is one of the most effective of the Ayurvedic acne treatments. It is taken orally.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 15" class="reference" id="_ref-15"><a href="#_note-15">[15]</a></sup> It may also be prepared as an ointment or gel.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 16" class="reference" id="_ref-16"><a href="#_note-16">[16]</a></sup> You can usually find this preparation from a homeopath, but you can also ask your doctor to find out how to find an effective preparation. Sunder Vati includes the following ingredients:<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 17" class="reference" id="_ref-17"><a href="#_note-17">[17]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Ginger</li>
<li>Kutaj (Holarrhena antidysenterica)</li>
<li>Biranga (Embelia ribes)</li>
<li>Indian gooseberry</li>
<li>Aloe</li>
<li>Turmeric</li>
<li>Guggulu</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7b/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-9.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_be8e13da99" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_be8e13da99')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7b/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-9.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try an Ayurvedic combination treatment.</b> Studies have suggested that trying a poly-herbal topical ointment, Shalmalyadilepa, and an oral treatment, Guduchyadivati, may be effective in reducing acne. Consult with an Ayurvedic medical practitioner.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 18" class="reference" id="_ref-18"><a href="#_note-18">[18]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Shalmalyadilepa contains Shalmali thorn (<i>Salmalia malabarica</i>), Vata buds (<i>Ficus bengalensis</i>), Jaatiphala fruits (<i>Myristica fragrans</i>), Lodhra bark (<i>Symplocos racemosa</i>), Massora seed (<i>Lens culinaris), and Raktachandana (</i>Pterocarpus santalinus<i>).</i>
</li>
<li>Guduchyadivati contains equal parts Guduchi (<i>Tinospora cordifolia</i>)<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 19" class="reference" id="_ref-19"><a href="#_note-19">[19]</a></sup>, Manjistha (<i>Rubia cordifolia</i>), and Krishnasariva (<i>Hemidesmus indicus</i>).<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 20" class="reference" id="_ref-20"><a href="#_note-20">[20]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-10.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-10.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-10.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-10.jpg" height="546" id="img_63a9ed06d7" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_63a9ed06d7')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-10.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-10.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Apply tea tree oil.</b> Tea Tree, <i>Melaleuca alternifolia,</i> is a native Australian tree that has been widely used in Aboriginal medicine. Studies also show that it is highly effective at combating acne when applied in a 5% solution once a day for three months.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 21" class="reference" id="_ref-21"><a href="#_note-21">[21]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Tea Tree oil takes a little longer to work than other acne treatments, such as benzoyl peroxide, but it also has fewer unpleasant side effects (e.g., itching, dryness, or irritation).</li>
<li>If you want the treatment to work a little faster, apply the oil to your skin twice a day, for 20 minutes per treatment. Wash your skin afterward with a gentle cleanser. Do this treatment regimen for 45 days.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 22" class="reference" id="_ref-22"><a href="#_note-22">[22]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Do not consume tea tree oil. It is toxic when ingested.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 23" class="reference" id="_ref-23"><a href="#_note-23">[23]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Using_the_Proper_Cleansing_Technique_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Using_the_Proper_Cleansing_Technique">Using the Proper Cleansing Technique</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-11.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-11.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-11.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-11.jpg" height="546" id="img_ce182f97d7" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_ce182f97d7')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-11.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-11.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Make washing a regular part of your routine.</b> Wash your face at least twice a day — once when you wake up to clear away oils that accumulate on the skin during sleep, and once before sleep to wash away the day's accumulation.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 24" class="reference" id="_ref-24"><a href="#_note-24">[24]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>You should also wash your face after periods of heavy sweating, whether you've gone to the gym or just been outside on a warm day. Take a bath at least once a day, and consider taking an extra shower after heavy sweating.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 25" class="reference" id="_ref-25"><a href="#_note-25">[25]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-12.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-12.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-12.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-12.jpg" height="546" id="img_c064c52533" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_c064c52533')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-12.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-12.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use a gentle, plant-oil based cleansing product.</b> Look for a cleanser labeled as “non-comedogenic.”<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 26" class="reference" id="_ref-26"><a href="#_note-26">[26]</a></sup> This means that the product doesn’t promote the formation of comedones (blackheads or whiteheads) or pimples.

<ul>
<li>Many brands — such Neutrogena, Cetaphil, and Olay — produce non-comedogenic products. There are also many off-brand or store-brand non-comedogenic products.</li>
<li>You can also look for non-comedogenic oils to dissolve skin oils and clean the skin. Always read the packaging to be certain. Popular non-comedogenic oils include hemp seed oil, shea butter, sunflower oil, and castor oil.</li>
<li>Avoid products that have alcohol in them, as it dries out and damages the skin. The dried, dead skin cells clog the pores, actually making acne worse.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 27" class="reference" id="_ref-27"><a href="#_note-27">[27]</a></sup><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 28" class="reference" id="_ref-28"><a href="#_note-28">[28]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-13.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-13.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/01/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-13.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-13.jpg" height="546" id="img_10b65e2b4c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_10b65e2b4c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/01/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-13.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-13.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use your fingertips to wash your face.</b> If you use a washcloth or sponge to work cleansers into your skin, reconsider that practice. These products are rough against your skin, can irritate it, causing more problems than they solve. Instead, use your fingertips to massage cleansers into your skin.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 29" class="reference" id="_ref-29"><a href="#_note-29">[29]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-14.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-14.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-14.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-14.jpg" height="546" id="img_9952b12fc2" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9952b12fc2')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-14.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-14.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Massage the skin gently.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 30" class="reference" id="_ref-30"><a href="#_note-30">[30]</a></sup> You may be tempted to scrub at your skin during your daily washing, but this is a bad idea. The cause of your acne lies under the skin, and you cannot treat it through scrubbing, which only irritates the skin and worsens surface inflammation. Using your fingertips, gently massage the cleanser into your skin for 10 seconds or less, taking care not to irritate existing acne.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-15.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-15.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/27/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-15.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-15.jpg" height="546" id="img_bfd74d6e07" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_bfd74d6e07')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/27/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-15.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-15.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Avoid exfoliation.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 31" class="reference" id="_ref-31"><a href="#_note-31">[31]</a></sup> Exfoliation can be good for healthy skin, but you shouldn't try to exfoliate acne-covered skin. It can cause both micro-scarring that can't be seen without magnification, and more obvious scarring.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 32" class="reference" id="_ref-32"><a href="#_note-32">[32]</a></sup> It can also pull away skin that's not yet ready to fall off, like pulling off a scab before it's ready. This can lead to scarring and discoloration.

<ul>
<li>Chemical exfoliants detach the dead and dying skin cells, but can be drying and irritating as well.</li>
<li>These over-the-counter treatments are different than the dermabrasion performed by dermatologists. A dermatologist uses techniques like laser resurfacing and microdermabrasion under magnification. They direct the treatment towards specific, very small areas, not the entire face. Professional treatments may not cause discoloration.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-16.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-16.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0f/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-16.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-16.jpg" height="546" id="img_0cae3b6248" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0cae3b6248')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0f/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-16.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-16.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Do not ever pop your pimples.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 33" class="reference" id="_ref-33"><a href="#_note-33">[33]</a></sup> Pimples, pustules, blackheads, and so on may look unattractive, but they’re actually working to keep the bacteria in your skin contained. When you pop a zit, the white pus that comes out and touches your skin spreads the very bacteria that causes acne.

<ul>
<li>If you absolutely must get rid of a pimple, see a dermatologist to lance it in a sterile, professional environment. At home, though, it’s best to simply let your zit run its course. Popping it might cause acne to flare up, lengthen the healing time, and increase scarring and discoloration.</li>
<li>In serious cases, picking or popping a pimple can cause a severe staph infection.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Treating_or_Avoiding_Underlying_Causes_of_Acne_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>4</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Treating_or_Avoiding_Underlying_Causes_of_Acne">Treating or Avoiding Underlying Causes of Acne</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_4">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-17.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-17.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/49/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-17.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-17.jpg" height="546" id="img_7e2a69284d" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_7e2a69284d')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/49/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-17.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-17.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Learn the importance of underlying causes.</b> You can treat skin blemishes all you want, but if you don't treat the thing that's causing it, acne will keep coming back. Now, this can't always be done. For example, if you're a teenager, your acne is likely a result of the fluctuating hormone levels that come with puberty, which can't be stopped until you outgrow it. You can also inherit a predisposition for acne from your parents, which can't be helped.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 34" class="reference" id="_ref-34"><a href="#_note-34">[34]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>However, there are many things that cause acne that <i>can</i> be helped, and you should take measures to avoid those behaviors.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-18.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-18.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9c/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-18.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-18.jpg" height="546" id="img_2c06819f60" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_2c06819f60')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9c/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-18.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-18.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Control androgen levels, if possible.</b> Androgens are a family of hormones that includes testosterone, which is produced by both men and women (though in higher levels in men).<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 35" class="reference" id="_ref-35"><a href="#_note-35">[35]</a></sup> Testosterone increases the body's production of sebum, an oil that moistens the skin and keep it healthy. But when you have too much testosterone, the body makes more sebum than it can expel, making sebum accumulate and clog the skin. This can lead to inflammation and acne.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 36" class="reference" id="_ref-36"><a href="#_note-36">[36]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Teenaged acne in both boys and girls is often due to increased androgens. Unfortunately, it's often worse in boys, who have higher levels, and the underlying cause is untreatable until they outgrow puberty.</li>
<li>Teenaged girls, though, can take prescription birth control to regulate their hormones, and therefore their sebum production.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 37" class="reference" id="_ref-37"><a href="#_note-37">[37]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Steroid use also affects androgens and sebum production. Stopping steroid use will likely improve the skin.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-19.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-19.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 19" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/21/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-19.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-19.jpg" height="546" id="img_898c3399e3" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_898c3399e3')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 19" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/21/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-19.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-19.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Raise your fatty acid levels.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 38" class="reference" id="_ref-38"><a href="#_note-38">[38]</a></sup><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 39" class="reference" id="_ref-39"><a href="#_note-39">[39]</a></sup> Omega-3 fatty acids protect your skin by limiting the body’s production of leukotriene B4. Leukotriene B4 is known to increase sebum production and lead to inflammatory acne. By bringing your Omega-3 fatty acid levels up, you can prevent uncontrolled production of leukotriene B4 and help prevent acne. Foods you should look for include

<ul>
<li>Walnuts</li>
<li>Avocados</li>
<li>Flaxseeds and flaxseed oil</li>
<li>Fatty fish (halibut, herring, mackerel, oysters, salmon, sardines, trout, tuna)<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 40" class="reference" id="_ref-40"><a href="#_note-40">[40]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Leafy green vegetables</li>
<li>Foods and drinks fortified with omega-3 fatty acids (check the packaging)</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-20.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-20.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 20" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-20.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-20.jpg" height="546" id="img_e8fe0f91ee" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_e8fe0f91ee')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 20" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-20.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-20.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Treat inflammations that can become acne.</b> Conventional thought on acne has been that its primary cause is bacterial, and it progresses to inflammation. However, recent research suggests that inflammation may actually lie at the heart of acne at all stages, not just late stages.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 41" class="reference" id="_ref-41"><a href="#_note-41">[41]</a></sup> The presence of bacteria, this research argues, only serves to make skin conditions worse.

<ul>
<li>Talk to your dermatologist about getting a prescription for anti-inflammatory medication to treat the underlying problem, rather than just treating the acne itself.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-21.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-21.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 21" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-21.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-21.jpg" height="546" id="img_9449db208e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9449db208e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 21" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-21.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-21.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Avoid foods that cause outbreaks.</b> Everyone’s body reacts differently to food. Your friends might be able to eat foods that make you break out, and not get a single pimple. Take note of which foods seem to trigger acne in your body, and take lengths to either reduce or eliminate those foods from your diet. Foods with a high “GI” (glycemic index) ranking may make acne worse.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 42" class="reference" id="_ref-42"><a href="#_note-42">[42]</a></sup> High-GI foods to watch out for include:

<ul>
<li>Processed foods such as white bread, bakery products, potato chips, and french fries. These are usually “simple” carbohydrates that don’t offer much nutrition. Choose low-GI foods such as whole oatmeal, whole-grain bread, vegetables, and beans. If you crave potatoes, sweet potatoes and yams are lower-GI than white potatoes.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 43" class="reference" id="_ref-43"><a href="#_note-43">[43]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Sugar. Your body’s ability to regulate blood sugar may be linked to acne. High-GI foods and beverages often contain significant amounts of sugar.</li>
<li>Dairy products. Dairy is not as strongly linked to acne as high-GI foods, but some studies suggest a connection. The American Academy of Dermatology does not recommend eliminating dairy products from your diet unless advised by your doctor, as they also contain essential nutrients such as calcium and vitamin D.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 44" class="reference" id="_ref-44"><a href="#_note-44">[44]</a></sup> Choose lower-GI dairy products such as reduced fat yogurt over high-GI products such as ice cream.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 45" class="reference" id="_ref-45"><a href="#_note-45">[45]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-22.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-22.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 22" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/74/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-22.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-22.jpg" height="546" id="img_90696a9ad3" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_90696a9ad3')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 22" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/74/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-22.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-22.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Quit smoking.</b> Research suggests a link between cigarette smoking and adult-onset, non-inflammatory acne, called “smoker’s acne.”<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 46" class="reference" id="_ref-46"><a href="#_note-46">[46]</a></sup> Though more studies need to be conducted on this link, a recent study of women found a direct correlation between the number of cigarettes smoked and the severity of acne. Reducing or eliminating cigarette smoking from your routine may be able to improve your acne.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-23.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-23.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 23" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-23.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-23.jpg" height="546" id="img_90c3b53d3e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_90c3b53d3e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 23" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-23.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-23.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Choose cosmetics and beauty treatments carefully.</b> Some cosmetics cause cells to build up in the hair follicles, causing black- or whiteheads that can become inflamed. This condition, called “acne cosmetica” or “cosmetic acne,” can be easily avoided by putting a little thought into what beauty products you put on your skin.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 47" class="reference" id="_ref-47"><a href="#_note-47">[47]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Look for non-comedogenic makeups that won’t clog your skin up, and avoid beauty products that have heavy perfumes in them.</li>
<li>Avoid lotions and makeups that include penetrating oils like lanolin or isopropyl myristate, which can also trigger acne.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-24.jpg?ajax=true&aid=203147" href="#/Image:Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-24.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 24" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-24.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-24.jpg" height="546" id="img_017404e2b5" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_017404e2b5')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Clear Pimples and Facial Marks with a Natural Indian Treatment Step 24" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-24.jpg/aid203147-v4-728px-Clear-Pimples-and-Facial-Marks-with-a-Natural-Indian-Treatment-Step-24.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Protect your skin from the sun.</b> A popular myth suggests that a tan can help treat and prevent acne, but scientists have found no evidence to support that.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 48" class="reference" id="_ref-48"><a href="#_note-48">[48]</a></sup> In fact, both the sun and tanning beds damage your skin and raise your risk for cancer. Always wear sunscreen and stay out of the sun during peak hours (10AM to 4PM).<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 49" class="reference" id="_ref-49"><a href="#_note-49">[49]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Be aware that some acne medications or other types of medication can actually make your skin even more sensitive to the sun. These drugs include antibiotics such as ciprofloxacin, tetracycline, sulfamethoxazole and trimethoprim; antihistamines like diphenhydramine (Benadryl); drugs used to treat cancer (5-FU, vinblastine, dacarbazine); heart drugs like amiodarone, nifedipine, quinidine and diltiazem; Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs like naproxen and the acne medications isotretinoin (Accutane) and acitretin (Soriatane).</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="384377" data-caid="385250" data-cqid="384394" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2084682" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="2">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">What can I use to remove and prevent whiteheads? </div>

<div class="qa_badge"></div>

<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">You can use benzoyl peroxide cream and that will kill the bacteria and prohibit the production of oil.</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="384381" data-caid="385254" data-cqid="384398" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1968268" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="2">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">My pimples are on my forehead. What should I do to remove my them? </div>

<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">You can use Jojoba Oil and leave it on over night, it helps with the pimples and the pigmentation. </div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="487037" data-caid="487910" data-cqid="487054" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2269798" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="0">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">I've had pimples all over my face for over a year now and they hurt. What should I do?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Remember to exfoliate, tone, cleanse and moisturize your face. Try natural remedies like honey and turmeric on the pimple. If it still gets worse, see a dermatologist.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="344596" data-caid="345469" data-cqid="344613" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2010878" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="0">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">What is meant by nutmeg?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">The hard, aromatic seed of a tropical tree. The tree is called also called a nutmeg tropical evergreen tree. The seed can be made into spices. You can find ground nutmeg at any grocery store.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="533142" data-caid="534015" data-cqid="533159" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2683459" data-submitter_id="4414975" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="0">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Is it bad to wear makeup if I have acne?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle" style="background-image:url(https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-MFXjNJgfCgg/AAAAAAAAAAI/AAAAAAAAAE8/ZR6s6Vdwjuw/s96-c/photo.jpg)"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"><span class="qa_user_link" data-href="/User:Bri-Gita">Bri Gita</span></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Unfortunately, makeup can cause acne and may make existing blackheads, whiteheads, pimples, and inflammation worse. Like other non-cleansing products applied to the skin, makeup can clog skin pores. Oil prone areas such as the forehead, nose, or chin are particularly susceptible, especially when excess concealers or powders are used to cover them.</div>

<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">

<ul>
<li>Tuna is an excellent source of omega-3 fatty acids, but it can also be high in mercury. Canned light tuna is usually lower in mercury than canned white/albacore tuna. Eat up to 12 ounces of lower-mercury fish per week.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 50" class="reference" id="_ref-50"><a href="#_note-50">[50]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Washing your face regularly really helps, it's because it makes your skin and pores clean.</li>
</ul>

<div id="summary_wrapper"><div id="summary_text">
<h2>Article Summary<a href="#" id="summary_close">X</a>
</h2>
<p>To clear pimples and facial marks with a natural paste, start by using a gentle cleanser to remove dirt and oil from your face. Next, combine 2 teaspoons (5.2 g) of nutmeg powder with mineral oil or shea butter. Apply the paste to areas of the face where you have blemishes or scars, and leave on for at least 2 hours. After letting it sit, wash off the paste and gently pat your face dry to avoid irritation. <span id="summary_last_sentence">To learn about other natural Indian face treatments, read on!</span><span class="sumpos_bottom" id="summary_position"></span></p>
